subject: Design
title: The iPod: 1,000 Songs in Your Pocket
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The iPod: 1,000 Songs in Your Pocket.

hook.text: In 2001, MP3 players existed but were ugly and confusing. Apple made one that was beautiful and simple.

buildup.text: Tony Fadell and Jony Ive designed a white rectangle with a scroll wheel and no buttons to label.

discovery.text: The click wheel let users scroll through thousands of songs with one thumb. No manual needed.

twist.text: The iPod itself was profitable, but iTunes â€” the software â€” was the real revolution in music design.

climax.text: The iPod proved that industrial design plus interface design creates products people love.

punchline.text: Apple didn't invent the MP3 player. They just designed one people wanted to use.

quiz.question: What made the iPod's design revolutionary?
options: Combining beautiful hardware with intuitive scroll wheel interface
